abstract: About 13 percent of Americans remain uninsured as Pres Obama prepares to leave office, after having passed health care reform law that increased number of insured by approximately 20 million; breakdown of demographics of those who remain uninsured provided.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: There are still about 24 million American adults without coverage, according to a survey by a health research group.
snippet: There are still about 24 million American adults without coverage, according to a survey by a health research group....

headline.main: Six Years Into Obama’s Health Care Law, Who Are the Uninsured?
headline.print_headline: Still Uninsured, Even With the Health Law
